hook.text: She valued patient care. The hospital valued throughput. Every day she worked against her own values. That erodes the soul.

buildup.text: When personal values conflict with organizational values, moral injury accumulates â€” even if the job seems fine.

discovery.text: Moral injury is the distress from being forced to act against your ethical beliefs. It's a hidden driver of burnout.

twist.text: Pay raises and promotions don't fix values misalignment. If the work violates what you believe, no perk compensates.

climax.text: Identify your core values. Compare them to your daily work. Persistent mismatch is a signal to change â€” not adapt.

punchline.text: No salary compensates for working against your values.

quiz.question: What is moral injury in the workplace?
options: Distress from being forced to act against ethical beliefs
